title: Will we ever get another mana restoring champion?
body: I'm curious because after the removal of Soraka's mana restore, which was honestly one of, if not the most unique ability in the game. But I'm just curious because it was **SO** nice to have a Soraka as an ADC, just having the ability to relax in a lane that adjusted to how well you were doing, whether it's  a passive or aggressive lane. I honestly don't consider it being toxic either, it's the same balance-wise as healing. But I really miss having Old Soraka and I was just curious if any champions were in the works for being the new old Soraka. {{champion:16}} _**HAIL THE GOAT**_

replies.body: It would be nice to have a champion with that ability again, however that champion probably should not also have a heal, I think the combo of heal plus mana granting was a little toxic
Agree, maybe a mana supplier based champ, that can "stealth mana or energy" to others.

I have to say that mana restoring will only be limited to self restoration through abilities like Malzahar's E. If Riot were to introduce a mechanic that restored mana on someone's kit, it'd probably be more of a minor mana restoration over time. Mana is meant to gate people, especially early game. Giving someone the ability to give someone else an instant chunk of mana would go against that gate, promoting a passive/non-interactive early game, while making that part of their kit near useless late game.

I have no idea what you are trying to say here.

> 1b) it could be set so it only gives mana when out of combat/ make it only affect allies if they are directly clicked

The out of combat idea would be nearly impossible to implement well.  Say I am not in combat and the enemy jungler is running in to gank.  If I throw my field in his way, it will do nothing to him because it was out of combat.  Say I was sitting in lane with my ADC and I feel like giving them mana.  Does the pool detect if they are in combat, and if so, does csing count as combat (it usually does)?  If so, they can't farm while getting mana back (a decent trade off I guess, but seems obnoxious).

If it returns mana when you click on them, then what happens in a fight when you want to drop a silence field around them?  You give them mana.  Great job Soraka, I am sure they wanted some mana while Rengar is ripping their face off.

>2)It doesn't have to be a large amount of mana and/or it could scale off something that would require her to lose help towards something else

Of course it doesn't have to be a lot of mana, but it doesn't take much mana to give someone several more casts than they would have had otherwise.  If you make it to low then you have the issue of it being not worth the mana cost and cooldown.  Why would you scale it off of something that doesn't fit the rest of her, and what would it be?  Max HP?  AD?  Giving her a bad scaling stat is just a way to not give her scaling.

>3) you always need mana, say it was after a small skirmish and some abilities were used or if it was a champion that uses mana frequently

Ok, unless you are a champ with a ridiculously small mana pool (or this is pretty early game), a small skirmish does not remove all of your mana.  If you are running out of mana while in a peaceful lane then the mana isn't the problem (unless peaceful includes poke).  If you are poking a lot and running out of mana doing so, then Soraka giving you mana will become a big problem for game balance.  Soraka is a lot of the reason that Urgot got trashed:  she gave him extra mana and so he had to be balanced around it.

> 4) it could drain Soraka's mana/use her hp like her health when she is giving mana

Yes, this would be a must.  If it didn't do that then the ability would give free mana since Soraka can also stand on the mana field.  You could just make it not restore her mana, but I like the idea of giving her incentive to stand on it with her ally other than staying in heal range.

The problem here is that Mana gating has become SO much harder now, with the Buff Nerfs, and the Changes in Mana Regen, while Energy Restoration has received no such nerfs.

What if we had an ability that reduced the resource cost of the next ability cast by target ally by 60/70/80/90/100%? On like a ~18-20 sec cool down? It would be useful, but would only allow one extra ability in a given trade or fight. (also, use of the term resource is meant to imply that it is useful for champs that don't use mana)

Uniqueness isn't inherently good. Old Soraka's mana restore wasn't unique, it was just bullshit. She just sits in bot lane and she AND her carry both get infinite sustain. Was it something anyone else had? No. Were there very good reasons for that? Yes. 

Mana restoring yourself as an ability should never be a thing because it just defeats the entire point of mana. 

Mana restoring other people is tricky to have in the game since A. it'll have to scale off your mana to cast and B. it's completely useless for manaless champions.

Ehh there are actually champions with Mana restoration for themselves
Like Sivir Spell Shield
Or Xerath Passive

And they do not defeat the purpose of mana
Xerath passive is there to push him into auto attack range so he can't just sit at max range and constantly poke (that's the idea anyways)

But notice that both of those mana restores required them to actually do something. Sivir has to predict an enemy spell and block it. Xerath has to give up his incredible range advantage to autoattack for it. 

Soraka just pressed E on herself and then continued spamming heals. The fact that mana restoration exists in the game doesn't make Soraka's mana restore a good thing.

I am pretty sure Soraka couldn't use her E on herself? So it didn't really give her infinite mana
So Soraka mana restoration doesn't really work unless she actually has anyone to give mana to (though of course it still works as it can also be cast on enemies)

She could give herself mana in Season 1, so she would just sit in bot lane handing out infinite sustain. That lead to her first rework. That rework is the one where she could give mana to other people, not herself.

Her second rework in Season 3 required her to pay a %max mana cost to use her mana restore (which could no longer be cast on herself) and changed her passive from a free MR aura to increased heal values on allies with low health.

Soraka's third, largest rework came out a little bit ago, and changed her into what she is now by building her rework2!passive into her heals, adding the %HP cost on W, completely reworking Q and E, and adding her current passive. No more mana regen to be found.

There was an item that was on the PBE for a very short amount of time that had an ability called "Mana Burst". If I recall correctly, Mana Burst restored mana to allies and dealt damage based on how much mana the user had. Too bad they never did anything with it, it looked like a really cool AP support item.
Look up "Mana Manipulator" and "Soul Shroud" sometime. That was a core item for my Soraka build back in the day.
"Ryze, please no." "Sorry, friend."
I enjoyed the old Soraka playstyle. It encouraged a truly passive lane where my adc could farm to power, rather than diving for kills.
